about.name: Aleksandr Yakovlev
about.bio: I build AI products and platforms from idea to scale, combining deep engineering, product thinking, and systems mindset. I shape technology strategy, architecture, and engineering culture, staying hands-on at the level of key decisions and core architecture. My focus is on scalable products that deliver measurable business impact and create strong, autonomous teams.

tasks: Focus: building a product + research direction for AI tools
Built a new corporate AI tools domain from scratch
Developed a Glean/Notion-like enterprise chatbot
Deployed 30B+ models to production
Delivered capabilities: RAG, Agents, Skills
Enabled tool integration via MCP
Focus: product transformation, strategy building, and product roadmap development
Supporting company product strategy for HMI and Taxi domains
Development of autonomous driving functions: safety, ADAS, deployment, and diagnostics of autonomous vehicles
Transformation of development processes using the V-model, with PI planning внедрение under SAFe/LeSS
Key result: products reached target maturity for Level 4 autonomous driving
Focus: engineering leadership and improving the reliability of delivered solutions
Built multiple development teams (20+ engineers)
Established a sustainable org structure and clear ownership areas
Implemented: quality gates, feature environments, A/B testing, monorepo, semver, GitFlow, acceptance testing, MDM+MAM, React 18
Launched autonomous transport products into production: driver tablet, passenger tablet
3D visualization system, and a screencast platform

I joined the company at the founder stage and built the engineering function from scratch, scaling it into a distributed team of 70+ engineers (backend, frontend, mobile, QA, DevOps). I was responsible for the development of the PaaS platform, on-premise deployments for enterprise clients, and co-development of applied solutions
Led technical consulting, defined architecture, and designed end-to-end solutions based on client requirements
Designed and delivered solutions for key customers — from initiation to industrial production, followed by transition to a SaaS model
Managed development and infrastructure budgets, planning, and prioritization
Introduced unified engineering practices and standards (code review, CI/CD, QA) and organized systematic training for client engineering teams
Implemented a multi-tenant platform architecture, reducing TCO, simplifying operations, and significantly improving scalability
